title.native: クロスアンジュ 天使と竜の輪舞
title.romaji: Cross Ange: Tenshi to Ryuu no Rondo
title.english: Cross Ange: Rondo of Angel and Dragon

description:
Betrayed, stripped of her birthright, and declared less than human. Everything that Princess Angelise Ikaruga Misurugi of the Misurugi Empire thought she knew about her world was a lie. Now, for the crime of not being able to use magic, she’s been sentenced to certain death as a slave-soldier. The girl now known as Ange is no longer an innocent Princess: she’s learning how to kill draconic invaders, defending the same traitors who stole her life. However, they made a fatal mistake: they gave her access to an incredible weapon.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Lacrosse
tags.description: A team game played with a ball and lacrosse sticks.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description: He made his debut as director on the first short of omnibus production Kimagure Robot and was later the director of tv series Mahou Shoujo Tai Arusu and its ova sequel, as well as director of the Russian co-produced film First Squad.

Akiko Shikata is a singer-songwriter and composer. She was born in Tokyo, Japan.  She's known for her contribution in the video game series Ar Tonelico and Shadow Hearts.  She also gave her contribution on Umineko no Naku Koro ni musics, such as the OP Theme for the Visual Novel and the Anime.  Recently she released her second maxi single, Inori no Kanata, that is Tales of Symphonia TETHE'ALLA Hen ED Theme.  She sings in multiple languages such as Italian, German, English, Celtic and Hymmnos, Ar Tonelico's Official Language.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fukuda320)

Rose to prominence by directing Shin Seiki GPX Cyber Formula which won the Animage Anime Grand Prix award. 

Fukuda also directed two more Anime Grand Prix award winners - Gundam SEED and Gundam SEED Destiny. With Gundam SEED, Fukuda managed to revive the popularity of Gundam after the commercial failures of Gundam X and Turn A Gundam, which is mostly observed by the selling power of Gundam model kits and toys that Bandai sells.

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
Started off as a composite artist.

Akiko Shikata is a singer-songwriter and composer. She was born in Tokyo, Japan.  She's known for her contribution in the video game series Ar Tonelico and Shadow Hearts.  She also gave her contribution on Umineko no Naku Koro ni musics, such as the OP Theme for the Visual Novel and the Anime.  Recently she released her second maxi single, Inori no Kanata, that is Tales of Symphonia TETHE'ALLA Hen ED Theme.  She sings in multiple languages such as Italian, German, English, Celtic and Hymmnos, Ar Tonelico's Official Language.

Holds a 2nd Dan rank in Kendo. A veteran Japanese voice actor who has played characters in anime, drama CDs and video games. Apart from voice work, Toshihiko Seki sometimes does live-action drama stage work and is a member of 81 Produce.

__Non-anime roles:__
• Dottore (Genshin Impact)
• Chongyue (Arknights)

Youko Takahashi is a Japanese singer, known for performing the opening and endings of several anime.

• "A Cruel Angel's Thesis" (残酷な天使のテーゼ), the opening theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "FLY ME TO THE MOON -4 BEAT VERSION-", the ending theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "Souls Refrain" (魂のルフラン), the ending theme to [Evangelion: Death and Rebirth](https://anilist.co/anime/31/)
• "Friends" (フレンズ), the fourth ending theme to [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) (as YAWMIN)
• "metamorphose" the opening theme to [Kono Minikuku mo Utsukushii Sekai](https://anilist.co/anime/146/)
• "Yoake Umarekuru Shoujo" (夜明け生まれ来る少女), the ending theme to [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/anime/355/)
• "Aoki Flamme" (蒼き炎), the opening theme to [Pumpkin Scissors](https://anilist.co/anime/1538/)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Website](https://erikitamura.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KITAxERI) | [King Records](http://king-cr.jp/artist/kitaeri/)

A Japanese voice actress and singer. She used to be a child actress by the name of Eri Okamura. 

She is primarily known for her role in Blood+ as Saya Otonashi and singing "Tsuyogari," the third ending for the anime series Konjiki No Gash Bell!! She is also known to be an amateur manga artist in Japan in her spare time. Kitamura is affiliated with talent agency Early Wing and was formerly affiliated with Kaleidoscope.

Currently works in the music unit ARTERY VEIN with Asami Imai. Also provides the voice of CUL, a Vocaloid.

__Height:__ 155 cm

[Website](http://king-cr.jp/artist/horie/) | [Profile](https://www.vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=8) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/horieyui-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/horieyui_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuihorie_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yui_Horie) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A0%80%E6%B1%9F%E7%94%B1%E8%A1%A3) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/4000.html) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/YuiHorieJP)

She is a voice actress and singer currently affiliated with vims. She hosts a radio show called "Horie Yui no Tenshi no Tamago" (堀江由衣の天使のたまご "Yui Horie's Angel Eggs") and is the founding member of the singing group, Aice5. She is also a member of the band Kurobara Hozonkai, with the name YUIEL. Her hobbies include shoulder massaging, reading and eating. She has been affectionately nicknamed "Hocchan" (ほっちゃん) by her Japanese fans.

**Non-anime roles:** 
- Faruzan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Freesia - Memento Mori (VG)

- Cotton Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Surtr - Arknights (VG)

- Charlotte Corday - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
